author: Finn-Olaf Jones
title: Why Bogotá is Now on Ambitious Travelers’ Agendas
text:
EVER SINCE COLOMBIA began shrugging off its don’t-think-of-visiting status, Cartagena and Medellín have emerged as glamorous tourist destinations. But until recently, Bogotá, the country’s capital and largest metropolis, held little interest for the outside world.
Geographically, the city has always been remote. The gold-mad Spanish built Bogotá deep in the country’s interior, next to the indigenous Muisca tribal mines on a mountainous shelf 8,600 feet above sea level. From this lofty position, Bogotá rode out the country’s...
